# **Reading**
Please contact me if you would like additional reading on a particular topic. I would be happy to share journal articles and extra resources. For books about moral psychology and moral philosophy for a general audience, I recommend:

- **Moral Tribes** *Joshua Greene*

- **The Righteous Mind & The Happiness Hypothesis** *Jonathon Haidt*

- **Just Babies & Against Empathy** *Paul Bloom*

- **Justice: What's the right thing to do?** *Michael Sandel*

- **What It Means to Be Moral** *Phil Zuckerman*

# **Talks**

- [Our buggy moral code](https://www.ted.com/talks/dan_ariely_our_buggy_moral_code?language=en) *Dan Ariely*

- [Moral behavior in animals](https://www.ted.com/talks/frans_de_waal_moral_behavior_in_animals?language=en) *Frans de waal*


- [The moral roots of liberals and conservatives](https://www.ted.com/talks/jonathan_haidt_the_moral_roots_of_liberals_and_conservatives) *Jonathan Haidt*

- [Science can answer moral questions](https://www.ted.com/talks/sam_harris_science_can_answer_moral_questions) *Sam Harris*


- [Progress is not a zero sum game](https://www.ted.com/talks/robert_wright_progress_is_not_a_zero_sum_game) *Robert Wright*
